name: Anthurium vanderknaapii
description: Anthurium vanderknaapii is an epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the Araceae family and features lance-shaped to oval, dark green leaves (20-40 cm long) with prominent white or silver veins. The plant displays an upright, compact growth habit and typically reaches 40-80 cm in height. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers typical of aroids. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its veined leaves. It's popular among aroid enthusiasts for its attractive foliage.
